title: Woman found dead 15 minutes before man she knew is killed by train
text:
The man died at Green Park tube station and his death is not being treated as suspicious (Picture: Backgrid)

A man and a woman who knew each other died just 15 minutes apart in separate locations in north London.

The woman, who is believe to be in her 20s, was found dead at an address in Brent at 12.07pm on Thursday after officers were called to the scene.

At 12.19pm a man, aged in his 30s, died five miles away at Green Park underground station. His death is not being treated as suspicious.

Formal identification is due to take place for both and post-mortems will be carried out shortly.

Police say the man and the woman knew each other, although Scotland Yard refused to comment on the nature of their relationship.

A Met Police spokesman said: ‘Detectives are investigating following the death of a man and woman on Thursday.

The woman was found dead at an address in Brent (Picture: Google Maps)

‘Police were called to a residential address in Ambleside Road at 12.07pm following reports of a death at the property.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Officers attended and found a woman, believed to be aged in her 20s, deceased. Police are in the process of informing her next of kin.

He added: ‘Police were informed by British Transport Police of the death of a man on the underground at Green Park at 12.19pm on Thursday.

‘His death is not being treated as suspicious.

‘The man, aged in his 30s, was known to the woman found dead in Ambleside Road.’

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
